info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 3:04PM CDT until June 14 at 3:34PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Hunt and Rockwall Counties.
Chambers Creek Near Rice affecting Navarro County.
South Sulphur River Near Cooper affecting Delta and Hopkins Counties.
Trinity River Near Long Lake (Oakwood) affecting Freestone, Leon and Anderson Counties.
Trinity River At Trinidad affecting Henderson and Navarro Counties.
Brazos River At Waco affecting McLennan County.
Leon River At Gatesville affecting Coryell County.
Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Robertson and Leon Counties.
Navasota River Above Groesbeck affecting Limestone County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...South Sulphur River near Cooper.
* WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur along the river reach. A few rural roads will be flooded. Moderate flooding will occur on farm and ranch land adjacent to the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON
